articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Israel's widely expected ground invasion of Lebanon appeared to be getting underway early on Tuesday as its military said troops had begun 'limited' raids against Hezbollah targets in the border area.
articles.title: Israel's Lebanon ground invasion begins with 'limited' raids on Hezbollah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the conscription of 133,000 new servicemen in Russia's autumn draft that starts Oct. 1 and goes until the end of the year, according to a Kremlin decree published on Monday.
articles.title: Putin orders conscription of 133,000 servicemen in Russia's autumn draft

articles.author: Andrew Gray
articles.description: Former Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte takes over as NATO boss on Tuesday, charged with holding the Western military alliance together with the war in Ukraine at a critical moment and a pivotal U.S. presidential election approaching.
articles.title: Mark Rutte set for NATO top job amid Ukraine, US uncertainty

articles.author: John Geddie, Tim Kelly
articles.description: Shigeru Ishiba was set to be voted in by parliament as Japan's next prime minister on Tuesday and unveil his cabinet as he seeks to heal party divisions and prepare for an Oct. 27 snap election.
articles.title: Japan's new PM Ishiba set to be formally anointed, unveil cabinet

articles.author: Karen Lema, Mikhail Flores
articles.description: Registration gets underway in the Philippines on Tuesday for one of the world's biggest midterm elections, headlined by what could be a bitter proxy battle between President Ferdinand Marcos Jr and fiery predecessor Rodrigo Duterte.
articles.title: Marcos-Duterte battle in focus ahead of Philippines midterm election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Emergency responders in North Carolina were racing to try to reach people who remain unaccounted for after the hurricane hit, killing nearly 100 people, wiping out communications and leaving millions without power.
articles.title: Hurricane Helene leaves dozens dead, many missing across US Southeast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A gang-fueled social and political crisis in Haiti has swollen the ranks of those suffering severe hunger in recent months, with an estimated 5.4 million Haitians having run out of food and gone a day or more without eating.
articles.title: Haiti conflict drives thousands toward famine

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: Taiwan mobilised nearly 40,000 troops on Tuesday to bolster rescue efforts as the powerful Typhoon Krathon approaching its populous southwest coast is expected to bring a storm surge and the coast guard raced to locate 19 sailors who abandoned ship.
articles.title: Taiwan warns of storm surge from powerful Typhoon Krathon, mobilises troops

articles.author: Ainnie Arif
articles.description: Indian Olympic wrestling star Vinesh Phogat was disqualified from the Paris Games, but she's determined to keep fighting for her constituency and against sexual harassment of women as she contests state elections this Saturday.
articles.title: Indian Olympian Vinesh Phogat swaps wrestling arena for politics

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three people were killed and 15 others injured in a knife attack at a supermarket in Shanghai on Monday, state-run Xinhua news agency reported, extending a series of stabbing incidents across China this year.
articles.title: Shanghai knife attack kills three, wounds 15 others, Xinhua reports
